Post title: Moodle mobile app 5.1.0 beta is ready for testing
Post description: Hi all, The Moodle mobile app version 5.1.0 is now available on Google Play and App Store Beta channels! We value your input immensely and would love for you to help us test this new version on your own Moodle sites. Your detailed feedback is crucial for ensuring a high-quality, stable final release for the entire community. How to join the Beta programme To join the beta programme and start testing, please follow these simple steps: Install the beta app following one of these links: Android or iOS Test your experience: Log in to your Moodle site and simulate a typical student session. This could involve browsing the forums, using messaging, checking the calendar, viewing course content, or completing an activity. Provide feedback: Please share any feedback or report issues you encounter through our dedicated Beta Testing Feedback survey . Feel free to share these Beta links with anyone in your organisation or community who might be keen to participate, including your students! Thanks for your collaboration! P.S. Specific focus areas for iOS testers : While we are interested in all feedback, if you have an iOS device (iPhone or iPad), we would be particularly grateful if you could check the following: Embedded YouTube videos are not displaying correctly within the Moodle app (see forum message for context ) On iPhones, the keyboard is sometimes displayed over the messaging input field (see MOBILE-4850 for reference)

Post title: Totally stuck with test automation
Post description: The intended outcome: Building a test automation framework for front-end functional tests. Tech stack is based on: Python, Pytest, Selenium. Inspecting the HTML (DOM) of the webpage to gather elements and their respective attributes in forming Page Object Model formatting. The issue: The Test Automation Engineer was able to successfully use these tools to authenticate and land on the OKTA dashboard , then click on the <System> card. Once landed on the home page of <System>, Selenium began to give ‚ÄòNoSuchElement..‚Äô exceptions. The Automation Engineer verified that the correct element and attributes were being used and tried in multiple ways ( CSS selector, XPATH, ID, LinkText, etc.) none of which returned a positive result. Then the tester tried other elements on the page, and same result as the previous. The troubleshooting: First instinct was to check if there was an ‚ÄòiFrame‚Äô that we needed to switch to before accessing the element(s), that was not the case. Second strategy was to see if there was a ‚ÄòShadowHost‚Äô in the DOM which was causing the existence of what is called a ‚ÄòShadowDom‚Äô. This has also been confirmed as not being the case. At least explicitly in a way that we can visually see. Third strategy was to try to use JavaScript Executor to interact with the elements, which failed, then creating a Javascript query to make sure that the javascript in the page was done loading before attempting to interact, which also failed. Needless to say, the explicit wait strategy of (wait.until.(EC‚Ä¶.) was used throughout all of these attempts. Also, just resulting in timeouts and no actionable info.

Post title: Moodle 5.1 QA Cycle starts today üéâ
Post description: Hello Moodle community, We're excited to announce that our Moodle 5.1 QA cycle begins today, September 1st, and will run for five weeks until the release date on October 6th . About the QA Cycle The QA cycle is a key part of our development process. This is when our community helps test Moodle's next version to ensure it's of the highest quality, reliability, and usability . How You Can Help Here's how you can get involved and make a difference: Exploratory Testing: Try out the latest Moodle features on our QA testing site. Experiment, explore, and share your feedback with us. Issue Reporting: If you find any issues, big or small, please report them on the Moodle Tracker. Your input is crucial to improving Moodle. For detailed instructions on the QA testing process, please check out the QA testing guide . If you have any questions, feel free to post in this forum or join our Moodle QA chat on Telegram or Matrix . Thank you for being such an essential part of our testing process. With your help, we‚Äôll make Moodle 5.1 a fantastic release! üöÄ

Post title: Moodle 5.0 QA testing cycle complete
Post description: We want to say a big thank you to all our QA testers for helping us complete 412 tests during this cycle! Your dedication made the 100% pass rate achievement possible. üß° All testers will be awarded a badge, so please ensure you have a valid moodle.org account and that your details are correct to receive it. üèÖ During this cycle, we identified some deprecated capability errors that appear during the upgrade process. The underlying issue, tracked in MDL-77237 , requires further work and has been deferred to be fixed after the Moodle 5.0 release. These messages, while unexpected, should not prevent the upgrade process from completing successfully. A big thanks to our core developers for their swift action in fixing the bugs we encountered during testing. Your hard work ensures we're ready for the release of Moodle 5.0! Lastly, thank you to everyone who contributed in any way‚Äîwhether through testing, investigating, or fixing bugs. Your efforts have been crucial in maintaining the quality and reliability of Moodle for educators and learners worldwide. üöÄüèÜ

Post title: Hint, how to avoid boilerplate file dockblock miss
Post description: Needed some big amount of tries to figure out why i was getting those lines in phpcs 1 | ERROR | Missing @copyright tag (moodle.Commenting.FileExpectedTags.CopyrightTagMissing) 1 | ERROR | Missing @license tag (moodle.Commenting.FileExpectedTags.LicenseTagMissing) 1 | ERROR | Missing docblock for file view.php (moodle.Commenting.MissingDocblock.File) Although everything seemed being correctly written in source files : Here is the hint : check you actually have the doctags and not mistyped (obvious ! that was not the issue) check your files are STRICTLY unix line-ended and converted to UTF8 with no BOM WHATEVER your text editor detects (sometime some may fail in reporting a good encoding detection)

Post title: Why is the Behat session user different from $USER?
Post description: How do you do, fellow devs. I recently ran into a few issues, while I was writing some custom Behat step definitions. I want to check that something is true for the "current user". In my own plugin code there is a function that takes the `global $USER` and checks for a record in the database related to the ID of that `$USER` . This seems like a perfectly reasonable thing to do, since `$USER` should always refer to... well... the current user. However, when I call that function from inside my Behat step definition, the `$USER` is different from the Behat session user (as returned by `behat_session_trait::get_session_user` ). To simplify, say I have an activity that users can subscribe to. I have a function in my plugin called `is_subscribed` that checks if there is a row in my subscription table with `userid = $USER->id` . Snippet of my Behat test (simplified): `And I log in as "user1"` `And I click the subscribe button...` `And I should be subscribed` That last step requires my own step definition that calls the `is_subscribed` function mentioned above. Again, very simplified: `public function i_should_be_subscribed() {` `$subscribed = is_subscribed();` `if (!$subscribed) {` `throw new ExpectationException("Not subscribed", $this->getSession());` `}` `}` The problem is that it turns out the `$USER` there is the Admin user, not "user1". Therefore the test fails. The workaround I found was to use the `set_user` method like this: `public function i_should_be_subscribed() {` `self::set_user(self::get_session_user());` `$subscribed = is_subscribed();` `self::set_user(); ¬†// reset, just in case?` `if (!$subscribed) {` `throw new ExpectationException("Not subscribed", $this->getSession());` `}` `}` The fact that `$USER` does not correspond to the Behat session user is mentioned in the documentation of `get_session_user` in passing, but I found no explanation anywhere. Maybe this is obvious, but not to me. My question is twofold: Why is this the case? Why are there two distinct "current users"? Is my approach sensible? If not, what should I do instead?
Label:

Post title: Behat error "Element is not clickable..."
Post description: I am gradually getting acquainted with running Behat tests on my localhost (Windows)... and getting my share of usual problems, etc. In the course of adapting the question/shortanswer behat tests to my own question/regexp question type I have come across a problem which has already been reported here . When running this query: ¬†vendor\bin\behat --config C:\wamp64\www\moodledatatest_behat\behatrun\behat\behat.yml ¬†--profile=geckodriver C:\wamp64\www\htdocs\moodletest\question\type\regexp\tests\behat\edit.feature I get this error message: 001 Scenario: Edit a Regexp question # C:\wamp64\www\htdocs\moodletest\question\type\regexp\tests\behat\edit.feature:25 And I choose "Edit question" action for "Edited regularshortanswer-001" in the question bank # C:\wamp64\www\htdocs\moodletest\question\type\regexp\tests\behat\edit.feature:36 Element <div id="action-menu-1-menubar" class="menubar d-flex "> is not clickable at point (575,674) because another element <div id="page" class="drawers show-drawer-left drag-container"> obscures it (Facebook\WebDriver\Exception\ElementClickInterceptedException) I can trace the problem to the fact that the Acceptance Test Site Firefox browser window is not large enough (height is insufficient) to display the Edit question" action drop-down menu. I can fix this by dragging the bottom of that window while the Acceptance Test Site is running (of course before it reaches line 36 in the feature script). But it is still a nuisance ! I tried to run my query with the --profile=headlessgeckodriver profile, but to no avail; I still get the "not clickable" error message. I've also tried to run it with Selenium, still no joy. Questions: Why at launch time does my Firefox browser window briefly displays full height, then reduced height? Is there a setting where I can fix this height, which would fix the problem? Or is there in my feature script a way to force it to either heighten the browser window, or enable a command to go fetch that invisible Edit question" action drop-down menu? Yours puzzled, Joseph

Post description: Hi all,¬† Firstly I am sorry if this is the wrong place for this question.¬† I am a complete newbie when it comes to educational software, but let me outline what I want to achieve, and please tell me if Moodle can offer this. 1. Login - Admin user, sub group member, and sub users under groups.¬† Admin user would be one person, this person is responsible for managing multiple sub groups and their users.¬† so for example, imaging you have a building manager (the admin) and in each of the 10 flats in the building, you have a parent (sub group member) who has 3 kids (admin can see parents and kids, Parents can only see the kids under them, and kids can only see each other.¬† Multiple Admin users, each with the same style hierarchy 2.¬† Admin user can create a list of tasks per family, and assign each task to one or more of the children in the family. 3. Each child once completing the task, puts a check in a box to confirm completion, and if needed (depending on the task) uploads a photo as evidence of completion 4. the Parent (Sub group member) logs in daily to confirm they have completed the task by adding another check to a box. 5. Post title: Moodle 4.0 QA test update.
Post description: Hello everyone, I'd like to say a big thank you to everyone that has helped with testing Moodle 4.0. We've tested an impressive 413 issue so far! We're not finished yet, and so I would encourage everyone to continue picking up any tests that you can to help us complete the QA testing. Post description: To test a plugin or core Moodle code, one can mimic travis on a Linux test server . 
```text
>cd /opt


>
git
 clone 
https://github.com/moodlehq/moodle-plugin-ci.git
 ci


>cd ci/


>composer install --prefer-dist


 >sed -i '/assertXmlFileEqualsXmlFile/d' tests/Installer/TestSuiteInstallerTest.php


>sed -i '/injectPHPUnitFilter/d' tests/Installer/TestSuiteInstallerTest.php
```

 Now run the command make and install all missing dependencies until you get output like:

```text
curl -LSs

php build/php-cs-fixer.phar fix -v || true


Loaded config default from ".php_cs".


...........................................................................................................................................


Legend: ?-unknown, I-invalid file syntax, file ignored, S-Skipped, .-no changes, F-fixed, E-error
```

```text
................
```

Forum Post: 
Post title: Useful tips for helping with Moodle 3.3 QA testing
Post description: I just wanted to offer some advice to anyone doing Moodle 3.2 testing. When you test things, the goal is to break anything that can be broken. Using names like " Test course " is not very likely to break anything, What is much more likely to cause havoc is creating your test course (or whatever) with a name like " x < 1 && x > 0 " since bits of that can easily get confused with HTML syntax, if the code is wrong. Also, given the nature of PHP the strings " 0 " (a single digit 0) is also very likely to cause havok like MDL-50893 , MDL-53964 , MDL-16427 , MDL-44981 , MDL-20960 , MDL-35620 (Wow! I did not realise how many times this had caused a problem. Note that list is not complete.) In the past, ' (since quote) was a useful test, because of how things were stored in the database , but it is much less likely to cause issues now. Even so, ' Fergal.O'Brien@example.com ' (or similar) is a good test email address. Also, other systems are not as good as Moodle at dealing with special characters. In other systems it can be very worthwhile testing with things like ' caf√© ' or ' Âõ≤Á¢Å ' but that is unlikely to be worth it in Moodle. Does anyone else have good tips for making your testing more likely to find bugs?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Suggested new Behat step for getting straight to the page you want to test
Post description: A lot of Moodle's Behat tests repeatedly test navigating around Moodle before getting to the feature they really want to test. For example: 
```text
    And I log in as "teacher"


    And I am on "Course 1" course homepage


    And I follow "Quiz 1"


    And I follow "Attempts: 1"


    And I follow "Review attempt"
```
 This is bad for several reasons: When the Moodle navigation structure changes, all our Behat tests break. This is why, at one point, the 'I am on "Course 1" course homepage' step had to be introduced to fix one breakage. The breakage that caused the '... in current page administration' to be created is another example. It makes the test take longer to run, becuase you have to load a whole lot of pages that you are not interested in testing. So, I think that we should have a step to go straight to the feature you want to test. (Of course, we should also have automated tests for how Navigation works, but we should test that once, not in every scenario.) I had a go at implementing this over at MDL-66335 / https://github.com/timhunt/moodle/compare/master...MDL-66335 . However, while the principle seems sound, I think the details need to be a bit better. In particualr, the steps like the following are not very human-readable. 
```text
    And I am on "mod_quiz" "Quiz 1" "edit"
    And I am on "mod_quiz" "Quiz 1/student/1" "attempt review"
```
 I am posting here in the hope that some people will look at what I have done, and have some good suggestions for how to make it better. Thanks.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Previous / Next buttons in 3.4
Post description: I'm working on MDLQA-10999 It is specific to the new (reintroduced?) next and previous buttons in Moodle 3.4. Right now, the patch has been very logical about how to deal with a variety of issues. For example, even if a file resource is set to "force download " if trying to navigate to it with the next/previous button, you still get a landing page with the link, because otherwise it would break up your flow of being able to move forward and back. I think that is logical and helpful. Slightly more problematic are issues like: How should labels be considered by Left/Right navigation? How should documents with an access restriction, that are visible to students be treated? If the next activity is only available through manual completion tracking, should there be a way to mark the current activity or resource completed without returning to the course homepage? 1) I would argue that labels need to be displayed using the previous next navigation. I know the faculty where I work are used to adding little bits of information, links or text into their courses using labels. Recently in Moodle, drag and dropping of images, and media files, the default action is to create a new label, with that media embedded into the course page. In addition, since 3.3 stealth activities can be created that are linked either through URLs or more commonly through labels. Those additions have enabled faculty to use more and more labels. 2) Right now if a document has an access restriction, even if it is visible to students, next/previous navigation will skip over it and automatically go to the next piece that the user actually can view. I think that this behavior should be changed to showing the student a page with the item, and the restriction to prompt them to do whatever it is they need to do. 3) To me this is the least important of my points, but like the above two things, it can mean that the next document is actually skipping over several items with restrictions on them. I worry that students will miss things through this next/previous navigation without even realizing it. Can some more people weigh in, about what the desired behavior should be? I made a comment on MDL-59612 . I think how this is addressed will be important to how useful this new feature is in 3.4.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Behat config path has been changed since 3.2.2
Post description: After MDL-54628 got integrated, behat directory structure has been changed a bit, so we can have more control on how behat parallel run work. behat.yml use to reside in $CFG->behat_dataroot/behat/behat.yml, From 3.2.2 it will now reside in¬†$CFG->behat_dataroot/BEHAT_PARALLEL_SITE_NAME/behat/behat.yml Default value for BEHAT_PARALLEL_SITE_NAME is behatrun, so path is $CFG->behat_dataroot/behatrun/behat/behat.yml Similar to above for parallel runs, path will be For 1st run: $CFG->behat_dataroot/behatrun1/behat/behat.yml For 21nd run: $CFG->behat_dataroot/behatrun2/behat/behat.yml and so on. This whole change was done to manage parallel and single behat in much better way and keep information about behat within¬†$CFG->behat_dataroot

Forum Post: 
Post title: Code mess detector tuning
Post description: I was recently discovering the results of the CMD tool in the travis-ci test plant. Some benefits are obvious, as some violation rules directly address missing variables, or mistyped variables, unused globals. I'm more doubting about the settings of cyclomatic and function length settings. Obviously, if you just design a very simple plugins with less then 10 files, you may not address such heavy algorithms that would need to pass the limits. Theoretical good practices would indeed pray for short functions, low number of public functions in class. that is obviously theoretic. In big plugins, promoting such good practices lead to a practical impossibility : multiply the number of function and number of small classes and you'll get an awfull to track and debug hyper-granular construct. We know one example of such implementation as Zend framework that we all know it is quickly unpenetrable. Being validating around 120 plugins of all sizes (from a small quickaccess rule to an around 100k lines integrated shop, very few of them (none in reality) would comply with the cyclomatic and complexity violations. So would'nt it be wise to soften the rules on those measurement ?

Post description: Hi everyone. A few days ago, I posted this message at "repository" forum with no answer. So I decided to try here. After understand the new path decided by "Moodle core" developers and read a lot of complains about the file management in Moodle 2.X, I think there will be necessary to make "repository system" stronger and intelligent to handle "minisites" via Webdav at least, in other words, html contents with images, css , etc. I read a message where Martin Dougiamas explains that MOODLE is no a "file repository", which is true. But the other true is that teachers are the main creators of learning materials and took advantages and motivation creating learning contents in HTML format. So it would be great if WEBDAV allows to link "minisites" build from HTML contents. After this explanation, here is my problem: I have some troubles setting up a webdav repository to show "minisites". The big purpose of this is to create a repository with a public and private area that will be accessed for several applications and one of those is Moodle. I want to keep centralized the maintenance of the content in one place. Here we go. SCENARIO: I have a repository directory which has two subdirectories: public and private. The public directory is not a problem because it can be accessed by anyone. The private directory is handled by webdav configuration with Apache2. From my MOODLE 2.4.1+ (Build: 20130222), I'm trying to show a popup window with content that comes from a directory located at webdav directory (private directory). I configured properly the webdav repository in Moodle and I can see the files in the file manager after selecting "My webdav repository". The private webdav repository has several subdirectories, each directory is a "minisite" with a "index.html" file in it. Another approach to solve this? Thanks in advance. Jos√©.

Post title: Behat: 'Should not be visible' for elements that do not exist?
Post description: Hi, I am attempting to automate MDLQA-1791 as per this tracker issue . This needs a step where editing is turned off for a created book and I need to check that the edit, delete, hide and add new links (images) are removed after that. I attempted to use 
```text
Then "Edit chapter \"1 My first chapter\"" "link" in the "Table of contents" "block" should not be visible
```
 but it gave me an error 
```text
Link matching locator "Edit chapter "1 My first chapter"" in the "Table of contents" "block"" not found.
```
 I believe that this is due to the fact that the element needs to be present but hidden in order for the above test step to work. However, in this case the element is completely removed from the page. Is there a better way to write this test step? Thanks.

Post description: Just imported the assignment in original post to QA Gradebook, Mary, and first response is a hope that Categories and Items will allow drag-and-drop rearrangement of items like activities and resources in courses when editing is turned on. Forum Post: 
Post title: Assumptions about unit tests
Post description: Can I just check that the following assumptions are right: There are legitimate reasons why an add-on might create something at install time, e.g. another user account, or a custom user profile field. Therefore, if a plugin that does such a thing causes a core unit test to fail, that is, technically a core Moodle bug. However, Moodle HQ probably have more important things to do that to fix bugs like that. So, if we care about these failures, we will probably have to fix them ourselves (as we and otheres have in the past). Thanks.

Forum Post: 
Post title: How to find more bugs while testing
Post description: Following an embarassing bug that has been around since Moodle 2.1, and which no amout of testing has found until some poor user hit it, I wanted to pass on the following tip. When testing, and when you are inputting some text (e.g. a forum post, or answering an essay or shortanswer question, try to include all the tricky things that might cause Moodle to break, for example: < > & < > & ' "¬†\ \' \" \\ Êó•Êú¨Ë™û % %%¬†$@NULL@$ @@TEST@@ Some things that are there: Characters that have special meaning in HTML. The escaped equivalents of those. Single and double quote characters, and backslashes. Back-slash escaped versionso of those. Unicode characters outside the usual ASCII range. (That is Japan in Japanese.) Various other characters that occasionally get used with special meantings. Hopefully automated testing will start to do this too. See MDL-37858 .

Forum Post: 
Post title: Please fail QA tests when you find setType() warnings
Post description: Hi Testers, You may have noticed that there during testing of Moodle 2.5 release there are little warnings popping out of the woodwork whilst testing like: Did you remember to call setType() for 'id'? Defaulting to PARAM_RAW cleaning. This is a new developer warning, to help us improve the security/robustness of our forms in Moodle, introduced by MDL-34311 . We've noticed that a few of your have been encountering these messages and passing your tests because it does not affect the functionality of Moodle. I'd like to ask if you do encounter these warnings (or any other warning whilst running QA tests), please fail the test. We are aiming to eliminate any of these developer warnings before release, and having the failed QA tests is a good way to ensure we do not miss any of them. Thanks a lot for all your hard work testing Moodle 2.5! Dan

Forum Post: 
Post title: Categories are too easy to move
Post description: Hi guys Not sure about the location of this post but I'd like to inform the developers of an issue I came across. We have just finished implementing Moodle at 7 academies for a large government organisation. When I trained the administrators one of the things I showed them how to do was to add, remove and move categories. We soon found out that the current way of moving categories is potentially risky since there is no confirmation step. In the training session the people whom I trained followed along by doing as I did and when I demonstrated how categories are moved into other categories we ended up moving things into places that were no longer where they were initially. This was a very complicated scenario that eventually meant that I had to restore the original database since the system could no longer create new categories or courses. Unfortunately I no longer have the full detail of the errors etc but I do think that the process for moving a category requires some attention.

Post title: Answer the questions as soon as possible
Post description: We are defining processes for company ¬†andwe need to establish a fluent process for QA as well. we need to define QA involvement from start to end in a life time of a project. These include answering few questions: What are industry standards? What is the role of QA at every stage of a project (from requirement gathering to delivery/deployment)? What is the input required from QA at every stage? What is the out required by QA for testing at intermediate stages till the end? What are those intermediate stages (depending upon the nature of a project)? What documents should be developed by the team (software engineers/ managers) to be used by QA? Format of those documents? Reporting format? Method to transfer subjected project from developers to QA for testing and vise versa? Final approval method from QA? These are just few points to start with for the upcoming projects. As for the immediate action point when our projects are in the middle or close to completion, please define what could be a smooth process of handing over a ¬†project to QA (alongwith required docs), expected response with expected time, developers first response to an error report and how we can reduce cross communication or back n forth movement of project.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Delay prevent some message popups
Post description: When testing you might find funktions that works as expected and therefore can be passed, though you find them strange or inappropiate. I have passed a test like that. When someone sends you a message you expect to get a popup if popups are activated in your settings and the sender also expect that you get a notification for the messages. But if you get 2 messages shortly after each other you will only receive a notification for the first message, which means that you might miss the second or won't see it until it is too late. As the system works now this is not a bug but a feature, there is a hard coded delay between popups to stop users who get a lot of messages being bombarded with popups. As I see it a delay can not stop spam if people know about the delay, but you can prevent the spam by blocking the spammers. The delay can only be irritating for people who do not know about it.. E.g. I send a message to you to tell you that the meeting will start a half hour later than planned. While you read my message I write a new because I forgot to say that you should not pick me up on the way. You do not read message number 2 because it came after you read the first but before the delay of sending out messages. So wouldn't it be better not to have the delay?

See http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=201355 The question is, who will write the QA tests, and who will write the user documentation? It sort-of feels like that that should be my job, since I developed the features, but on the other hand, if someone like, say, Tim Barker or Helen did it, then they time I save could be used for fixing other quiz bugs. Plus, if someone else did it, that would be a more independent check of the new system. ... am I doing an even slighly convincing job of selling this, or am I just being lazy?

Post title: Live testing and deploying plugins
Post description: How do you all deal with live testing plugins in a large Moodle site? It would be extremely useful if we could limit a plugin to a given context (ie. category, a few courses), so that it could be tested on the live server with real people. Certainly new plugins need to be tested in a sandboxed environment first, but ultimate testing requires real people and real data. Does anyone have any interesting approaches to this? As far as I know, Moodle does not offer an ability to limit a plugin by context, like how you can constrain a Filter by context.

Post title: Cron.php Failure - "Found more than one record in fetch() !"
Post description: Cron .php no longer completes successfully on my Moodle site. It reaches the step labeled "Starting the completion cron...", hangs for a few seconds, and then prints "Found more than one record in fetch() !" and aborts. I had had received a similar error (however just within a course) when I dupicated activites in a course with activity completion active. As soon as I deleted all of the duplicated activities , I was able to view activity completion options again without the error.¬†I have also duplicated courses with activity completion enabled and set-up and am now seeing an error of the same name in the cron.php script info. I have deleted the course which was duplicated, but the error persists. This sounds like a large bug; I am wondering if anyone has experienced this and/or is familiar with the issue. Running health.php returns no problem found. Moodle 2.1.1 is the version. Thanks, Joey

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle testing script
Post description: Hi, I work for Totara, which is a distribution of moodle, and as part of our QA process we've written a number of test scripts designed to automatically check a site for various types of errors. We run these scripts on a number of installs (windows and linux servers, different databases, etc) before each release. The first script is a spider which follows all the internal links looking for PHP errors, database errors, missing language strings, 404s and moodle error boxes. It includes some whitelisting so you can exclude 'known' errors. It should also be fairly easy to extend to include other types of checks. The code is here: https://github.com/totara/Totara-test-scripts/blob/master/link_checker.php Since the script runs on any moodle site (it was designed for 1.9 but seems to work on 2.0 too), I thought I'd share it here. We've got some other scripts too but they are a bit specific to our setup at the moment - I'll try and tidy them up and add them to the repo too. Simon

Forum Post: 
Post title: Programmatic generation of Drills and Tests from Db
Post description: Can someone please tell me if the following concept is currently available, potentially possible, or precluded by structural assumptions in Moodle? Rather than constructing individual quizzes, I think it should be possible to build various kinds of drills followed by tests, all of which are drawn programmatically from databases. Imagine, for example, a database of birds that includes fields like <common name>, <scientific name>, <audio file of call>, <image of male>, <image of female>. ¬†Imagine that the database consists of 1000 birds, and the ornithology students are expected to master all the data it contains. Drill and Test templates could be designed that give data with some fields (e.g., <call> and <image>s) and ask for (and validate against) <common name>. ¬†Another template might give <common name> and ask for (and validate against) <scientific name>. Individual drills or tests based on those templates would give limited numbers of questions filtered by certain fields. ¬†E.g., Drill 1 consisting of 50 birds whose field is listed as <Unit> = 1. ¬†Drill 2 would programmatically load items where <Unit> ‚â§ 2. ¬†Etc. A Test could be assembled by stipulating: Question 1 uses Template X and record id Y. Such a module would be applicable to a wide variety of fields and would allow much more rapid drill and test design. ¬†Faculty could input the database to Excel, save as .csv, and upload to db. Again, suggestions as to feasibility and how to get it done if it is feasible would be much appreciated. ¬†Thanks.

Post title: Time to move Dropbox off "sandbox"?
Post description: hi folks, When I last looked (July 2010), the Dropbox core team wasn't taking applications for new API keys for web apps... but they're certainly now doing it. Although the Tracker item ( http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-19168 ) is marked as Resolved, I've noticed that the plugin currently is hardcoded to use the Dropbox "sandbox" (i.e. lines 35 and 53 of https://github.com/moodle/moodle/blob/ac582c3b2547816ac1f7695bba710c48840f0f98/repository/dropbox/locallib.php and the corresponding language strings). Is there a reason for this? Is it worth submitting a patch switching 'sandbox' to 'dropbox' (I have this in a git branch)? This enables the ability to login and browse files correctly (although I'm still getting errors importing files). Cheers, Myles C

Forum Post: 
Post title: Link to the section in the breadcrumb changes course view mode to one topic permanently
Post description: In moodle 2.0 link to the section is added to breadcrumb. This produced some unexpected behavour. Steps to reproduce: 1. Go to the Moodle Features Demo Course, and in any assignment. 2. Choose "assignment" on the breadcrumb - you are now looking on the course in one-topic mode. 3. Choose "Moodle Features Demo" on the breadcrumb - you are still in one-topic mode. 4. Logout and login as the same user again - you are stuck in one-topic mode (unless you press "show all topics" icon). This is more serious bug then it may be seen because I frequently notice that many moodle users even after year of experience don't know about one/all-topic icons. These white squares don't draw much attention. It is often needed to show confused students how toggle all-topics more, and now that will be a lot more often. I guess this should be fixed.

Post title: Can't overwrite a file already uploaded to the Repository
Post description: Hi, If you upload an image or other file then decide to edit the file and upload it again, you have to give it a new name. I am using the File System "Common Instance" folder in Moodle 2.0 RC1 (Build: 20100927). I uploaded an image via FTP to repositories/FileSystem/images and used the File Picker to incert the image into a course.¬† Then I decided to¬†edited the image in Photoshop and uploaded it again via FTP to replaced the old version with the updated version using the same file name. When I tried to incert the updated image into the course, the File Picker would not let me reselect the file.¬† It said "ERROR, file already exists".¬† It would not overwrite the file already stored in the database . I had to rename the image file and using the File Picker select it and incert the updated image into the course under the new file¬†name.¬† That means that the OLD IMAGE FILE is still in the database taking up server space.¬† There is no way to delete the old file. I have reported this as a bug in the Tracker MDL-24410 Clarence

Post title: Moodle 2.0 Preview 3 Installation Woes
Post description: Hi guys, I'm having some pretty serious issues trying to install Moodle 2.0 Preview 3 into my development environment, and I was wondering if anyone could help me out. A little background on the server in question: It's an Ubuntu VM -based sandbox server, PHP 5.2.10, with Moodle 1.5 through 1.9 installed in different subdirectories, and links out to the office MySQL and PostgreSQL servers. I have a similar sandbox on Windows that links to these as well as MS SQL Server. It gives me a wide range of test environments, and now I'm trying to add Moodle 2.0 to it. As the VM is one of a multitude running on this particular remotely-accessible development machine, its webserver runs on a non-standard port. I initially installed Moodle 2.0 ages ago, so far back in fact that it was basically useless, so I ditched it and decided to install from scratch. No database , no files, nothing. This is a completely clean installation. When initially running the installer, it attempts to auto-detect its web address, and almost gets it right, except for the port number. I seem to remember 1.9.x and earlier getting the port number right, but the reason this becomes a problem is that I can't edit the web address displayed! The form box is disabled for some reason, which is hugely irritating. So I figured I would edit it myself using Firebug . With that done, I hit save, and go through the various DB setup bits. However, as soon as it writes out the config.php file, and before creating the database, I am redirected to the wrong address. Turns out the system ignores whatever value you put in the wwwroot box - it simply isn't passed through to the rest of the form, and $CFG->wwwroot is set to whatever the installer decides is correct. So I edited the config.php file on the server and added the port number to wwwroot, which has previously been all that's needed. When I do this and then try to access the site, it goes thoroughly mental. First, it displays this error:

Post title: Moodle 2.0 Backup / Restore
Post description: This is an involved question, but I have to ask it. In our current 1.9.x installations, we currently backup 1) the code [occasionally], 2) the database [my sql dump], and 3) the data contained in moodledata. The backups are stored in various places including tape. Now, it doesn't happen very often, but occasionally someone will delete¬†a course without making a course backup, or not include everything in the course backup, or something similar. I have to restore the sql database to another location, find the data for the course and restore that, and using the backed up code, access the site to recover the course. It's kind of a drawn out process, but reliable. My question is, how, using the new repository file system, do I make a backup that I can later restore. The code and the database is pretty much the same, but the moodledata area has drastically changed. One (at least I don't know how to) cannot locate the data associated with a course like you used to. I'm assuming that the data in moodledata is basically pointers to where the files are actually stored, but how do I resolve those when I'm having to do a restore? I hope the question makes sense ... Greg

In several of these cases I've tracked down exact line numbers and suggested suitable fixes, but I've not seen any movement on any of them in the weeks since they were reported. I'm sorry if I'm being a impatient, but several of these could be fixed very easily and with Moodle 2.0 heading for release next month (?), I'd really like to see some progress on them. MDL-22686 - Assignments - long filenames submitted by students + low screen resolutions makes marking of assignments impossible (not sure exactly how to fix this one) MDL-22635 - Embedding a text file in a resource fails to display the text file ( javascript bug identified with line number) MDL-22659 - assignment type plugins cannot preprocess settings form data (needed to allow plugins to include files in the settings form) (patch proposed to fix this) MDL-22499 - teachers unable to view profiles for students on their course (unless the teacher is given global permission to view profiles) (not sure how to fix this one) More minor bugs, but still annoying:

Forum Post: 
Post title: FTP or SFTP file upload
Post description: I have noticed that there is probably no way for a teacher, course creator or admin to upload a file via ftp as the file system is incredibly confusing. This may be a show stopper for some of my larger clients who regularly upload very large packages that exceed the php limited upload size of their site. Suggestions such as splitting their uploads into smaller packages or increasing the upload limit have been flatly refused. The one suggestion that has been met with some positive reception is that we have the ability to set a more granular role based upload limit. The interface would list the different roles and allow the administrator to set the site wide limit for the role. Thereafter course creators or teachers can set the course or activity limits for students if they feel they are too high. Another suggestion would be to have a general directory that would allow people to import a file after ftping it. The file would be deleted from this directory on a successful transfer to the correct course. Any other suggestions would be welcome.

Post title: Any triggered event for sending a message between users?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Likely bug in Participants list (user/index.php)
Post description: Greetings...¬† I just reported¬†this bug in the tracker: http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-10537 Our installation is version 1.7, so I don't know for sure that this bug affects newer versions.¬† But from studying the code, I believe it will. If someone can test this on the latest code, and reproduce the problem, that would be great.¬†¬† Eventually I'll get a test platform of 1.8¬†installed, and¬†upgrade our site to that version (we have some local customizations, so it's nontrivial.) ... but that might be¬† awhile, and I'm afraid in the meantime, this bug¬†will get lost in the tracker, buried among other 1.7.x bugs. Here's my description of the bug... --------------------------------------------------------- Bear with me.. this one is tricky to describe. But we can reproduce it easily, and I've been studying the code for two days,so I'm pretty sure it's a real bug. There is a bug in the user/index.php page that causes users to sometimes not display. It occurs when you have a number of unique participants <20, but a number of "non-hidden" role assignments greater than 20. Throughout this code, SELECT DISTINCT is used to count users... but there is one place where it is not used. In version 1.142, see line 323. That query does not use DISTINCT, so it will retrieve duplicate rows for any user who has more than one "non-hidden" role in the course. Maybe you have 23 role assignments, but only 19 unique users. The Participants page will say something like 19 total participants, but if you count the people (rows), you will see only 17. Get_record_ sql is retrieving just the first 20 records out of the 23 role assignments. Among that set of rows are 17 unique people. But the total count of unique users is <20, so you don't see paging commands. You just see one page, which says 19 users at the top, but has only 17 table rows. We noticed this because in one of our classes, we accidentally gave four Teaching Assistants a TA role and an Instructor Role. So we can easily fix the data and avoid this bug. There are other situations, however, where we need to have users with more than one non-hidden role... In several classes, a student in the class has been selected to act as a Teaching Assistant. So, that's a valid situation where the bug would apply if the count of students is just right... Best regards, -Garret

Forum Post: 
Post title: Problem login in when stressing Moodle 1.8 with JMeter
Post description: We are trying to stress our server using JMeter. When we have about 50 users in the system, nobody can login anymore, even admin or guest. We are using Manual accounts to authenticate. Looking at the source code and the database we have found a field in the table mdl_user called mnethostid that has to match with the value of mnet_localhost_id set in mdl_config table. At the beginning mnethostid of all users is set to 1, and mnet_localhost_id is set to 1 as well, but when we have almost 50 users in the system mnet_localhost_id has changed to 3 (we don't know why) and then it's impossible to login. If we manually update mdl_config setting mnet_localhost_id to 1 you can login again. We don't have enabled Moodle Network authentication, so we don't know why this value is changing. We are using Moodle 1.8. Anybody has had the same problem?

Forum Post: 
Post title: mod_deflate and file.php
Post description: Hello all, I know it's a really busy time what with the upcoming release of 1.8, but I was hoping others might be able to help me pin down an issue we've been experiencing with Apache 's mod_deflate and Internet Explorer. The background to the "bug" is on the tracker here: http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-8382 Essentially, files being served by file.php are being compressed by mod_deflate. Poor old Internet Explorer doesn't seem to understand this. When a user requests a zip file, it is compressed (because Apache assumes PHP's output is text, I think), and Internet Explorer cheerfully hands it to your unzipping application without inflating it first. The user is presented with an error message that the zip file is corrupt. Firefox , naturally, knows what to do. I'm trying to zero in on specific implementations where the problem occurs. I can recreate the error on Apache 2.0.58 and 2.0.59 running on a Windows box. This is our mod_deflate configuration: AddOutputFilterByType DEFLATE text/html text/plain text/ xml If anyone has the time to do so, I'd be extremely grateful if you could enable mod_deflate on your Apache test server and see what happens when you try to download a zip file using Internet Explorer. A number of workarounds exist, most of which don't require changes to Moodle code. I'd like to find out which is best and document it in the wiki.

Post title: Provide Timely and Meaningful Validation Messages
Post description: I stumbled upon a number of problems while attaching files where I got a failure message which was completely unrelated to the true cause of the problem. Had attached a file whose size exceeds that specified in php.ini which by default is set at 16 Meg. Instead of being told that it exceeds maximum attachment size, I got "A required parameter (id) was missing". The warning should say that the file attachment size exceeds the maximum allowed of.... This is the message that is given when one attaches a file in exceeds of the maximum on moodle forum. This problem is throughout Moodle 1.7, whether attaching a file to the Files, to a course, a podcast or a forum post. Would be useful to have the Max size in the settings displayed next to the attachment field whenever that applies. See Moodle Forum example.

Post title: testing time-dependent events
Post description: Are there any tools (or techniques) used by testers to simulate real time? For example, do you have a way of setting "today" to be some arbitrary date? This would be valuable for testing real-time events in activities . For example, suppose it is February 2007 and a course contains a Workshop with submissions due by 15 Sept 2005. To allow submissions, set the simulated time to any date before 15 Sept 2005, make some submissions, then set the simulated time to 16 Sept 2005, advancing the Workshop to the assessment phase. It would be a lot easier (and more dependable) than adjusting the dates in the Workshop settings themselves. If such a capability exists, my second question is: Could it be made available to users?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Users can't edit posts in single discussion forums
Post description: I think this might be an old bug, back to haunt us in Moodle 1.7. I found it in the tracker at http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-5551 as resolved. I'm finding that where I've got a forum set up so a user can only start 1 discussion (type = eachuser), no-one can edit a post after it has been made. I've dug around in the code a bit, and I think this is how it works... In forum/post.php it tests forum_user_can_post_discussion at line 749. That function tests forum_user_has_posted_discussion where $forum->type=='eachuser' in forum/lib.php at line 2943, but nowhere takes into account whether the user has the right permissions to always edit, or the time the post was made. I'm not clear where else those functions might be used, so I didn't want to go tweaking them by myself. BTW I've checked the 1.7 release but not the latest stable branch, so apologies if you've fixed this one and I didn't notice. Jenny

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle 1.7 Beta 2 and release timeline
Post description: I've been *so* keen every day for more than a week now to release 1.7 THAT VERY MORNING, but every day we just keep finding more and more bugs to fix. Eloy and I just bumped the version number to 1.7 Beta 2, because it feels like we have reached a sort of plateau now. I would like to have a final release by Tuesday 7th at the very latest. In the meantime, could we really have some concentrated testing and particularly patches from developers for existing bugs in 1.7 ? If you don't have access to CVS just post them to the tracker as attachments. Make sure you mark new bugs with "Affects versions" as 1.7 so it gets on the above list. The worst area currently is the AJAX course formats, which are not near production quality at the moment ( here is the AJAX bug list ). At the moment we have 1.7 set with AJAX off by default (look under Admin/Miscellaneous/Experimental) and the feature deferred, but wouldn't it be good to have it working in 1.7? The two developers who know anything about it are not available right now (original author was a Google SOC student and Vy is now on holiday), so your help would really be appreciated solving remaining issues. The other big areas are of course the Roles and the new database support. Please test thoroughly on real data (eg copies of production sites), trying different combinations and so on, to see if things work as expected. If you're game, you could even upgrade your production site already to get more realistic feedback (Moodle.org has been running 1.7 for a couple of weeks, for example). Lastly, even if you're not a developer, you can help with testing resolved bugs to confirm those things are fixed.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Some Test Results with UTF-8 in 1.6
Post description: I have been running some tests on Eloy's test installation of 1.6 for UTF-8. I am testing its capabilities of handling Unicode extended Latin characters, as that is what I am interested in at the moment. I also have run some Arabic tests. Here are my results (all run in Windows XP): 1-I have encountered no problems with using the HTML editor with Latin extended in Firefox , whether I specify the font or not to be used, Firefox is smart enough to find the characters in fonts I have installed on my system. IE 6 is a big problem though. Unless the font is specified, it will not find the characters. And if you specify a list of fonts, it will only draw characters from the first font on the list that it finds on your system, even if that font does not contain all the characters it needs. It will not go down the list looking for other fonts that have those characters, and instead will just insert little boxes. It can recognize what you are typing, and save it in the database , but it will not display it. Consequently, anything not entered with the html editor, such as forum subject titles, search entries, etc., will not display the proper characters unless a font containing ALL of the required characters is found on your machine and is the first font IE finds on your computer from the list of fonts specified in CSS . 2-I haven't run as extensive tests with Arabic, but here are my results. Strangely enough, the first problem I noticed was with Firefox, not IE. I typed Allahu Akbar ÿßŸÑŸÑŸá ÿßŸÉÿ®ÿ±. Normally, if you type the word Allah, it automatically add voweling marks. In the html editor, these voweling marks appear, but when it renders it on the page, they disappear in Firefox, but appear in IE. Not a serious problem and may be related to the fact that different fonts seem to be standard on Firefox and IE for the test site, but just something I noticed. When I switched to Arabic as my default language on the site, more serious problems appeared (the following are only test results from Firefox, I didn't check these issues with IE6). A more serious issue is that blocks are switched to the opposite side of the page, and consequently, the arrows for moving the blocks to the other side of the page point in the wrong directions. For example, the block on the right has an arrow pointing right with the tool tip text saying it will move to the right, which would be off the screen. The names of the font sizes in the html editor are inversed, instead of 1 (8 pt) it reads (pt 8) 1. Typing English with punctuation anywhere but in the HTML editor puts the punctuation in the wrong place, so creating a quiz called "Why is it a problem?" displays as "?Why is it a problem."

Post title: Survey Module Test Code
Post description: I made some minor changes in the usability of the survey multi-choice agree/disagree question types. I found the default row of buttons to be annoying. Someone might think it means "strongly strongly agree". I also thought the scale disagree-agree (left to right) to be the wrong order. I think it should be agree to disagree (left to right).¬† I think the careless respondant to the survey is most likey to click on the the buttons on the left which would be disagree. I think I'd rather facilitate agreement as opposed to disagreement. So I reversed the order of the scale (including the radio button values) and rewrote the javascript validation. I'd appreciate any feedback. If these changes found there way into the next release I wouldn't mind at all.¬† The code is attached.

Post title: Testing the new timezones on moodle.org
Post description: Moodle 1.5 has a lot of new code relating to the handling of timezones and DST (thanks Jon and Martin L for their work on this!) It's complex stuff, and I'd like to see a big test of this before we put out Moodle 1.5 Beta 1. If you are reading this, can you please edit your profile right now and set the timezone to the closest region/city for you (don't use the GMT* entries). Then keep an eye on the times around Moodle (the last access date in your profile is a good one but also try some calendar entries in the far future or past). If you notice anything wierd, please post here! Make sure you include: the timezone entry you are using, what you should be seeing and what you are seeing.

Post title: re: Bug #2991 - Setting font size to small makes world TOO small on IE6
Post description: The thread below addresses the IE font size problem. http://groups-beta.google.com/group/comp.infosystems.www.authoring.stylesheets/browse_thread/thread/c85bbaf76f0512d8/45431abe0e60237c?q=IE+css+text+size+smallest+fonts+small+text+problem&rnum=5&hl=en#45431abe0e60237c Jan 22 2004, 3:07 am¬†¬†¬†¬† show options Newsgroups: comp.infosystems. www.authoring.stylesheets From:¬† - Find messages by this author Date: Thu, 22 Jan 2004 11:09:00 +0000 Subject: Re: handling multi browser font sizes Reply to Author | Forward | Print | Individual Message | Show original | Report Abuse wrote: >Noozer / 2004-01-22 01:56: >> Why not just omit the 100% altogether? >The page author should set body { font-size: 100% } if he's going to >set font-size of any element (say h1, h2, h3, span.footnote etc >etc). This is because MSIE has a bug that causes View:Text Size >control to freak out if any font size is defined with percentage >unit without specifying font size of body element. Not true. The bug in IE is when font-size is set in ems then the size difference is vastly inflated when the user has anything other than Medium set. So the solution is to either: 1. Set 100% on the body and then use ems 2. Use percentages throughout in which case you don't need an explicit size set on the body. Compare http://steve.pugh.net/test/tes¬≠t67a.html and http://steve.pugh.net/test/tes¬≠t67b.html to see the bug in action. So it might be the¬† "font-size:0.95em;"¬† setting. body, td, th, li { font-family:"Trebuchet MS", Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size:0.95em; } - Eric ps: do I have to sign up to add to bugs or is it my 'Using Moodle' login info?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Hidden activities and resources are really hidden
Post description: In order to ensure that when a teacher hides a resource or an activity that students really can't get at it, even if they know the direct links to its pages, I have given an optional third argument $cm to the functions require_login() and require_course_login(). Pages showing information about a particular course module should pass the course module object in this third argument. The login functions will then test if either the course module is visible or the user is a teacher. If neither is the case then the user is redirected to the course homepage after being shown a message "Sorry, this activity is currently hidden". This was discussed in Bug #2450 I therefore changed most module pages and may well have made a typo somewhere, so please let me know if something stops working. (While I was at it I also turned the autologinguests off for most module pages, except on the index.php pages and the view.php pages for those modules that allow guests).

Forum Post: 
Post title: Front page activities
Post description: There is now a new configuration variable $CFG->allusersaresitestudents which defaults to true. As it says on the configuration page: "For activities on the front page of the site, should ALL users be considered as students? If you answer "Yes", then any confirmed user account will be allowed to participate as a student in those activities. If you answer "No", then only users who are already a participant in at least one course will be able to take part in those front page activities." Can you please test that this really works the way it should? The details are: When $CFG->allusersaresitestudents is true then all users with confirmed undeleted accounts who are not admins or explicitly enrolled as site teachers should be viewed as site students. When $CFG->allusersaresitestudents is false then all users who are students or teachers in any of the real courses but are not teachers on the site course should be viewed as site students. Not all modules follow these rules yet: Assignment, Attendance, Dialogue, Exercise, Journal and Workshop access the user_students tables directly to determine who is¬†a student. They will are using the following, independent of the value of $CFG->allusersaresitestudents: All users who are students in at least one real course are viewed as site students. The standard modules that I believe are following the proper rules are: chat, choice, forum, glossary, lesson , quiz, scorm , survey, wiki. If you have $CFG->allusersaresitestudents set to true then be careful. Site users have no way of deleting their user accounts. So if for example you use force subscription to a forum then that amounts to having people on a mailing list from which they can't remove themselves.

Forum Post: 
Post title: New Chat daemon is running on moodle.org
Post description: The new chat daemon is running on moodle.org for you to try out. You should find it pretty fast - Jon has done some great work on it so far. Finally, the chat is currently running on port 1024 (the admin chooses this). Some of you may not be able to use chat at all because of a firewall blockage. Don't worry about this, I don't plan to use the daemon in the long term on moodle.org. In a large installation like a University they could run this daemon on a small separate server for the purpose and use port 80 for maximum compatibility with everyone's firewalls. What I'd really like is for programmers to run it locally (it's in CVS on the trunk) and to see if they can help us identify some of the remaining small problems that it has. The user list is currently using the old method, so ignore that for now. The new method, which uses the daemon, is still having a few issues but should be enabled in CVS soon. Occasionally, on some browsers, you will see "Document has no data" dialogs popping up ... Sometimes, typing a message will be sent out two or three times to everyone.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Random default enrollment ( enrolment ) keys
Post description: In our Moodles we want to keep enrollment 'closed' on our courses by default (ie. so that even available courses need instructor approval to enroll). Necessity being the mother of invention, and open source being open source, I added a bit of code to fill the enrollment key field with a random alphanumeric string (of limited random length) by default, replacing the¬† original line (124) $form->password = ""; with these $randomekeysize = rand(5, 10); /// determines the length range for the keys for ($i=0; $i<=$randomekeysize; $i++) { do { $asciinumber = rand(48, 122); } while ((($asciinumber > 57) && ($asciinumber < 65)) || (($asciinumber > 90) && ($asciinumber < 97))); $randomekey .= chr($asciinumber); }

Forum Post: 
Post title: Logging in visitors as guests automatically
Post description: Since day before yesterday there is an option autologinguests on the site variables page that¬†allows you to configure your site so that any visitor that is not logged in is logged in automatically as guest user when entering any course that allows guest access. See http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=9161 . This makes Moodle behave more like a CMS and this may be appropriate on certain sites. It is possible to disable this autologin on individual pages by giving a second argument equal to false to the require_login() function. So if you are using this autologin feature and find that it is inconvenient on particular pages, let me know and I will add the false argument to the require_login on that page. Unfortunately I will be away on holiday for two weeks without email contact. But when I come back ...

When he enter in a course page, he read "Forum Insegnanti" (the italian translation for "Teacher forum") in the Administrator menu but the rest of page is correctly translated in English. Post title: New HTML editor
Post description: The new HTML editor (HTMLarea) is now in CVS , as of version 2003102900. I integrated Janne's great work so that using the new editor is optional. Unless you activate it everything will continue as before. To activate the new editor (as I have done on this site already) just include this line in your config.php. $CFG->useneweditor = true; Eventually (when the new editor is more polished) it will be the default editor. Comments, bug reports and other work can all go in the new HTML editor forum .

Post title: Modular quiz reports
Post description: There is now a modular system for quiz reports in mod/quiz/report/xxxxxx/ in CVS . Modules can be written that produce reports on the current quiz and dropped into that directory. I've converted the old "quiz overview" and "regrade quiz" reports into modules, and written a new one called "simplestats" that produces some simple statistics that help you see which questions the class is having the most trouble with, and which ones they are answering well.

Forum Post: 
Post title: A module suggestion...
Post description: I was setting up Moodle for a friend of mine who will be using it while teaching high school theatre next Fall. As I was helping her add in some sample Assignments, she asked me if there was a way to place Holidays and other "events" in her course (which is in weekly format). We settled on creating Assignments that were simply text with the Holiday name and "No School" as the description. My suggestion was, how difficult would it be to create a module for "Events" that could be used for class holidays, special events, announcements, or specific news items that need to fall chronologically in a class. Maybe there is an existing way that I am just missing...any thoughts? Oh, and by the way, I am BLOWN AWAY by Moodle. I am turning all my teacher friends onto it! Keep up the great work everyone! -Jeff

Post title: "Forgotten password" routine now uses confirmation
Post description: I just fixed another little thing that had been bothering me for a long time - anyone could reset someone else's password from the login screen if they now the other person's email address. The new scheme now sends a confirmation email first, containing a coded link. Clicking on the link then causes the password to be changed and mailed out as before. This should prevent a possibility of annoyance by troublemakers.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Improved performance on Recent Activity
Post description: I only recently noticed that users who had been away for a few weeks who were trying to get back in to this course (Using Moodle) were having the course page become very slow and sometimes never finish loading! The problem was too much data to process when creating the Recent Activity display (lots of things happening in this course!) which overwhelmed the way I was doing it (it wasn't very scalable). I've just implemented a new method which appears to give roughly the same speed for small courses, but also gives decent performance on large courses too. Yay!

Post title: Moodle mobile app 5.1.0 beta is ready for testing
Post description: Hi all, The Moodle mobile app version 5.1.0 is now available on Google Play and App Store Beta channels! We value your input immensely and would love for you to help us test this new version on your own Moodle sites. Your detailed feedback is crucial for ensuring a high-quality, stable final release for the entire community. How to join the Beta programme To join the beta programme and start testing, please follow these simple steps: Install the beta app following one of these links: Android or iOS Test your experience: Log in to your Moodle site and simulate a typical student session. This could involve browsing the forums, using messaging, checking the calendar, viewing course content, or completing an activity. Provide feedback: Please share any feedback or report issues you encounter through our dedicated Beta Testing Feedback survey . Feel free to share these Beta links with anyone in your organisation or community who might be keen to participate, including your students! Thanks for your collaboration! P.S. Specific focus areas for iOS testers : While we are interested in all feedback, if you have an iOS device (iPhone or iPad), we would be particularly grateful if you could check the following: Embedded YouTube videos are not displaying correctly within the Moodle app (see forum message for context ) On iPhones, the keyboard is sometimes displayed over the messaging input field (see MOBILE-4850 for reference)

Post title: Totally stuck with test automation
Post description: The intended outcome: Building a test automation framework for front-end functional tests. Tech stack is based on: Python, Pytest, Selenium. Inspecting the HTML (DOM) of the webpage to gather elements and their respective attributes in forming Page Object Model formatting. The issue: The Test Automation Engineer was able to successfully use these tools to authenticate and land on the OKTA dashboard , then click on the <System> card. Once landed on the home page of <System>, Selenium began to give ‚ÄòNoSuchElement..‚Äô exceptions. The Automation Engineer verified that the correct element and attributes were being used and tried in multiple ways ( CSS selector, XPATH, ID, LinkText, etc.) none of which returned a positive result. Then the tester tried other elements on the page, and same result as the previous. The troubleshooting: First instinct was to check if there was an ‚ÄòiFrame‚Äô that we needed to switch to before accessing the element(s), that was not the case. Second strategy was to see if there was a ‚ÄòShadowHost‚Äô in the DOM which was causing the existence of what is called a ‚ÄòShadowDom‚Äô. This has also been confirmed as not being the case. At least explicitly in a way that we can visually see. Third strategy was to try to use JavaScript Executor to interact with the elements, which failed, then creating a Javascript query to make sure that the javascript in the page was done loading before attempting to interact, which also failed. Needless to say, the explicit wait strategy of (wait.until.(EC‚Ä¶.) was used throughout all of these attempts. Also, just resulting in timeouts and no actionable info.

Post description: We want to say a big thank you to all our QA testers for helping us complete 412 tests during this cycle! Your dedication made the 100% pass rate achievement possible. üß° All testers will be awarded a badge, so please ensure you have a valid moodle.org account and that your details are correct to receive it. üèÖ During this cycle, we identified some deprecated capability errors that appear during the upgrade process. The underlying issue, tracked in MDL-77237 , requires further work and has been deferred to be fixed after the Moodle 5.0 release. These messages, while unexpected, should not prevent the upgrade process from completing successfully. A big thanks to our core developers for their swift action in fixing the bugs we encountered during testing. Your hard work ensures we're ready for the release of Moodle 5.0! Lastly, thank you to everyone who contributed in any way‚Äîwhether through testing, investigating, or fixing bugs. Comment 10: I get the same error when upgrading from Moodle 4.3 to 4.5 (Build: 20241007). When I searched all of the source code of my Moodle 4.5 LMS site, the only instance of the line "/cache/classes/loaders.php" that I could find was in the theme Boost Union. Comment 11: Good to know. Boost Union needs fixing then - we rely on it too... Comment 12: Hi all, thanks for this heads up. We are aware of this issue in Boost Union. There is a issue reported on https://github.com/moodle-an-hochschulen/moodle-theme_boost_union/issues/708 and a pull request on https://github.com/moodle-an-hochschulen/moodle-theme_boost_union/pull/720 .
Comment 13: Hi all, thank you very much for your patience waiting for Boost Union 4.5. Our refactorings and tests are done and the 4.5 release has been pushed out today to https://moodle.org/plugins/theme_boost_union/v4.5-r1/33573 . If you encounter any additional issues on 4.5, please raise them on https://github.com/moodle-an-hochschulen/moodle-theme_boost_union/issues . Cheers, Alex
Comment 14: Thanks a lot. In my case I use LearnR so must wait...
Comment 15: There is a Workaround for this: Go to `theme/boost_union/classes/cache/loader.php` And comment out the Line 29 like this: `// require_once($CFG->dirroot.'/cache/classes/loaders.php');` Then you'll be able to update the Database . I had no Issues since then with the Theme, and the System is up and running again until the Update arrives.

Your teamwork and dedication made the 100% pass rate achievement possible. üß° All testers will be awarded a badge, so please ensure you have a valid moodle.org account and that your details are correct to receive it. üèÖ We would also like to highlight a specific issue we've identified with Microsoft OneDrive, where teachers are unable to edit documents stored on OneDrive using controlled links. We have confirmed that this is not a regression in Moodle but rather an issue on the Microsoft side. To address this, we have created MDL-83341 for further investigation and resolution. A big thanks to our core developers for their swift action in fixing the bugs we encountered during testing. Your hard work ensures we're ready for the release of Moodle 4.5! Post title: Hint, how to avoid boilerplate file dockblock miss
Post description: Needed some big amount of tries to figure out why i was getting those lines in phpcs 1 | ERROR | Missing @copyright tag (moodle.Commenting.FileExpectedTags.CopyrightTagMissing) 1 | ERROR | Missing @license tag (moodle.Commenting.FileExpectedTags.LicenseTagMissing) 1 | ERROR | Missing docblock for file view.php (moodle.Commenting.MissingDocblock.File) Although everything seemed being correctly written in source files : Here is the hint : check you actually have the doctags and not mistyped (obvious ! that was not the issue) check your files are STRICTLY unix line-ended and converted to UTF8 with no BOM WHATEVER your text editor detects (sometime some may fail in reporting a good encoding detection)

Post title: Why is the Behat session user different from $USER?
Post description: How do you do, fellow devs. I recently ran into a few issues, while I was writing some custom Behat step definitions. I want to check that something is true for the "current user". In my own plugin code there is a function that takes the `global $USER` and checks for a record in the database related to the ID of that `$USER` . This seems like a perfectly reasonable thing to do, since `$USER` should always refer to... well... the current user. However, when I call that function from inside my Behat step definition, the `$USER` is different from the Behat session user (as returned by `behat_session_trait::get_session_user` ). To simplify, say I have an activity that users can subscribe to. I have a function in my plugin called `is_subscribed` that checks if there is a row in my subscription table with `userid = $USER->id` . Snippet of my Behat test (simplified): `And I log in as "user1"` `And I click the subscribe button...` `And I should be subscribed` That last step requires my own step definition that calls the `is_subscribed` function mentioned above. Again, very simplified: `public function i_should_be_subscribed() {` `$subscribed = is_subscribed();` `if (!$subscribed) {` `throw new ExpectationException("Not subscribed", $this->getSession());` `}` `}` The problem is that it turns out the `$USER` there is the Admin user, not "user1". Therefore the test fails. The workaround I found was to use the `set_user` method like this: `public function i_should_be_subscribed() {` `self::set_user(self::get_session_user());` `$subscribed = is_subscribed();` `self::set_user(); ¬†// reset, just in case?` `if (!$subscribed) {` `throw new ExpectationException("Not subscribed", $this->getSession());` `}` `}` The fact that `$USER` does not correspond to the Behat session user is mentioned in the documentation of `get_session_user` in passing, but I found no explanation anywhere. Maybe this is obvious, but not to me. My question is twofold: Why is this the case? Why are there two distinct "current users"? Is my approach sensible? If not, what should I do instead?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This initially confused me as well (when I first started with Behat testing, many years ago), so hopefully I can help explain. There are basically 2 things going on with Behat tests. 1. A process running directly on the server - which can directly call functions and insert records in the database (and which is a single process, running continually through all your Behat tests - so you have to be careful about any static variables in your code). This is where all your step functions are run. 2. Calls which are made via the browser and which call back to the server. These are the steps that log in as a particular user and carry out steps. Each request via the browser is a separate process (just like when. a user is accessing the site normally), but session cookies retain a single user login for the duration of a particular Behat scenario (unless the scenario specifically logs out). So, steps that call functions directly on the server cannot access the $USER global for the user who is logged in via the browser, in the same way that a scheduled task running on your server wouldn't be expected to be able to access the $USER global for a user who happened to be logged into your site at the same time as the scheduled task was running. If you want to check whether a user is subscribed, then you'd need to get the step to navigate them to a page where they can see their subscription status (and then check for that text on the page). Alternatively, you could write a step that checks to see if a particular user is subscribed (e.g. And user "username" is subscribed to activity "name of activity").
Comment 2: The fact that these are actually two separate processes makes sense of course. I guess I just wished that whenever the Behat session user was changed, it would sync up the `global $USER` along with it in the Behat process. (I am not sure, but it seems that it does not change at all throughout the test.) But maybe that is too difficult to accomplish for some reason or would conflict with some other internal machinery. Your first suggestion is reasonable. After all, Behat tests are supposed to verify things that are visible on the page , not things that may or may not exist in the backend. So I guess the approach I took with the `is_subscribed` check inside a step function is fundamentally at odds with the testing principles here. Would you agree? The alternative would be to perform a direct DB lookup from the custom step function (without relying on `$USER` being set). Thank you!
Comment 3: THX for the explanation. For a long time I wondered why the Behat function i_set_the_field_with_valid_code (admin\tool\mfa\factor\sms\tests\behat) is working with the global $USER and not with the session user.¬† Perhaps the global $USER variable is equal to the session user only after the Behat step¬† 'I follow "Preferences" in the user menu'?

```text
POST request

Body of your POST request{


¬† ‚Äúcapabilities‚Äù: {


¬†¬†¬† ‚ÄúbrowserName‚Äù: ‚Äú
firefox
‚Äù


¬† }


}
```
